title: Spectral Unmixing of Ultrastructure in Large-scale Electron Microscopy
content: Automated electron microscopy (EM) enables the capture of large cellular areas and volumes at nano-scale resolution. The homogeneity of the captured images and their large sizes present a challenge to even the most advanced computer vision methods, which limits the possibilities of analyzing them automatically. We present a new approach of analyzing EM data, which utilizes Energy-dispersive X-ray (EDX) imaging. We demonstrate the effective recognition and localization of biological structures using hyperspectral analysis of EDX data. This is illustrated by a diverse set of large-scale EDX acquisitions of a multi-cell biosamples, as well as a volumetric single cell acquisition. The richness of the acquired data, along with the proposed method of analysis, create new possibilities for the automated analysis of life science EM data.
